If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.

evidence.pdf_reference: The representative TiO 2 loaded with cocatalyst (e.g., Pt) have been used extensively for the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction in solar-to-chemical energy conversion.However, it still suffers from low efficiency, due to the weak adsorptionactivation of CO 2 .In this work, an MgAl layered double oxides (MgAl-LDO) was successfully introduced into the interface of PtTiO 2 , by in-situ deposition of MgAl layered double hydroxides and subsequent high temperature calcination.The structure, optical property and the

slightly detectable CO and CH 4 in the absence of light or catalyst, confirming CO and CH 4 were actually derived from the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 on TiO 2 based photocatalysts.Fig. 5a In another experi-ment, we note that MgAl-LDOTiO 2 without Pt deposition exhibits slight photocatalytic activity toward CO 2 reduction, which might be owe to that MgAl-LDO itself is not the reactive catalytic site for CO 2 reduction.Thus, we speculate that the enhanced activity should come from the multi-synergistic

theoretically.The ratio of O 2 (CO 4CH 4 ) for our results is calculated as 0.53, with slightly higher than the theoretical one.Such deviation might be related to the slightly incomplete vacuum degassing and the generation of the minor undetectable H 2 .This suggests CO and CH 4 are the main products from the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 over our proposed photocatalysts.coordinated with H and transformed to HCO 3 ).The enhanced peak intensity of m-HCO 3 A and the relatively low peak of OH groups on TiO

holes 19,20,39.Further loading with Pt as cocatalyst, the PL emissions of MgAl-LDOTiO 2 was almost completely quenched, indicating Pt cocatalyst was essential and effective for the transfer of photogenerated electrons. The photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 over MgAl-LDOTiO 2 was performed by using solid-gas interface reaction mode, where CO and CH 4 were found to be the major products.In the mode, water molecules was oxidized to generate O 2 , H and e 40.Control experiment shows slightly detectable CO and

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.

1 h and subsequently under UV irradiation for 1 h at room temperature to record the corresponding spectra.Spectra of the adsorbed species were obtained by subtracting the catalyst spectrum. The photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 with H 2 O was carried out using gas-solid mode in a Pyrex reaction cell connected to a closed gas circulation and evacuation system.The light source was a topirradiated 300 W Xe lamp (LS-SXE300 CUV, Beijing Perfectlight Technology Co. Ltd).Typically, 20 mg of catalyst was evenly

was suspended in 25 mL H 2 PtCl 6 solution containing 0.01 molAL A1 methanol as hole scavenger.The suspension was irradiated with a 300 W Xe lamp for 1 h.The sample was then recovered by filtration, followed by washed repeatedly with water and dried at 80 C overnight. The crystalline phases were characterized by X-ray powder diffraction (XRD) on a Bruker D8 Advance powder diffractometer using Cu Ka radiation (operating voltage: 40 kV, operating current: 20 mA, scan rate: 5min).UV-visible diffuse

(TEM) and high resolution TEM (HRTEM) were performed on a JEOL JEM-2010 TEM (Japan) with the accelerating voltage of 200 kV.The contents of metal elements were determined by an inductively coupled plasma-atomic emission spectrometer (ICP-AES, Optima DV2100, PerkinElmer, USA).Steady-state photoluminescence (PL) spectra were carried out on a FLS980 fluorescence spectrometer (Edinburgh, excitation source, 450 W Xe lamp; excitation wavelength, 350 nm).Specific surface area was analyzed by nitrogen

reaction was conducted under light irradiation at 20 C for 8 h.The generated CO and CH 4 , as well as H 2 and O 2 , were determined by an on-line GC 7900 gas chromatograph (Shanghai Tianmei) equipped with methanator, flame ionization detector (FID) and thermal conductivity detector (TCD), and the relative standard deviations for the amounts of H 2 , CO and CH 4 formed were 5.
